item.description:

item.title: No need to issue EO on Panglao, El Nido rehab - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
No need to issue EO on Panglao, El Nido rehab  SunStar Philippines

PRESIDENT Rodrigo Duterte will not issue an executive order on the rehabilitation of tourist spots Panglao Island in Bohol and El Nido in Palawan, Malacañang said on Wednesday, December 5. This was agreed upon during a Cabinet meeting presided over by Duterte at the Malacañan Palace on Tuesday, December 4, Presidential Spokesperson Salvador Panelo said. "On the rehabilitation of Panglao Island in Bohol and El Nido in Palawan, the Cabinet agreed that there is no need to issue an Executive Order," the Palace official said in a statement. On November 9, the Department of Tourism announced the ...

item.title: EL NIDO: Garbage woes threaten the future - Rappler
item.description:
EL NIDO: Garbage woes threaten the future  Rappler

READ: PART 1: EL NIDO: Tourism's boon and bane EL NIDO, Palawan – These days, it’s not only the resorts and restaurants in El Nido’s town center that is feeling the growth of its local tourism industry. About 7 kilometers from the town center, El Nido’s 4.3-hectare landfill in Barangay La Libertad has been feeling the negative impact of the influx of tourists and uncontrolled development. The volume of garbage collected in El Nido has doubled since 2014, the year before tourist arrivals in the town hit the 100,000-mark. The increase does not only put also additional pressure on the town’s l...

item.title: Plan a getaway with Mac Planner - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Plan a getaway with Mac Planner  SunStar Philippines

- TRAVELING is made more available and affordable especially for the youth with Mac Planner Travel and Tours which just opened their branch at Abreeza Ayala Malls, Wednesday, November 28. “In this generation, travel is a trend. Even the youth wants to travel. We want them to experience affordable traveling because we offer affordable promos, packages, even hotel accommodations,” said Marjorie Billie Macale, one of the owners of the family-owned business. She added they mostly cater to international travels directed to Asian countries such as Hong Kong, Indonesia, Thailand, Malaysia, and Sin...

item.title: El Nido: Tourism's boon and bane - Rappler
item.description:
El Nido: Tourism's boon and bane  Rappler

EL NIDO, Palawan – In announcing the government’s plan to rehabilitate El Nido in Palawan last November 14, Tourism Secretary Berna Romulo-Puyat described it as “overcrowded.” It’s the same word that some residents, businessmen, and local officials nowadays use to describe their hometown. They've experienced a tourism boom in recent years that has transformed their local economy but has also resulted in pollution and uncontrolled development. Located in the northern tip of Palawan, El Nido, a first-class municipality with 18 barangays and 41,000 residents, has hogged the headlines in recent...

item.title: El Nido fails coliform test after registering above 1,000 level - ABS CBN News
item.description:
ABS CBN News

EL NIDO, Palawan - Tourist haven El Nido failed a coliform test after at least 2 bodies of water in the resort town recorded high levels of fecal coliform, official data made public Wednesday showed. The Cabigsing River and water from Barangay Buena Suerte both had a 1,300 most probable number (mpn) of fecal coliform, data from the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) showed. The standard water quality for swimming is 400 mpn. The local government expects coliform levels in the resort town to come down once officials dismantle establishments that failed to comply with envi...

item.title: Travel and Leisure names Palawan, Boracay as 2017's best islands - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Travel and Leisure names Palawan, Boracay as 2017's best islands  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, July 13) — The Philippines once again proved it's home to some of the best destinations in the world as two of its islands bagged top spots in an international travel website's list of world's best islands. Palawan ranked number one on Travel + Leisure's "The World's Top 10 Islands" list in 2017 for the second year in a row. Boracay, was number three on the list, it added, down a notch from number two in 2016. Palawan was rated a 93.15 out of 100 while Boracay scored 89.67, the article on travelandleisure.com said. The ranking was based on readers' ratings bas...

item.title: Lumawag: A feast at El Nido, Palawan - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Lumawag: A feast at El Nido, Palawan  Sun.Star Philippines

AFTER enjoying the cold weather and majestic views of Northern Luzon, we found ourselves in the beautiful beaches and the islands of El Nido, Palawan for the second part of Mei's tour. While we enjoyed the beauty of El Nido, we also enjoyed the delicious food during our tour here. The guides really brought out their best cooking abilities and prepared a very delicious feast for us. Prior to the delicious feast we had at the beaches of El Nido, we also enjoyed a delicious meal prepared at the Cadlao Resort and Restaurant, where Mei and her siblings stayed in the first night. We had merienda ...

item.title: 10 Great Palawan Hostels That Are Under P1,000 - FHM Philippines
item.description:
10 Great Palawan Hostels That Are Under P1,000  FHM Philippines

There are many reasons why Palawan has been voted the best island in the whole dang WORLD for two straight years: the beaches are incredible, the marine life is insane, the people are tremendously friendly, the food is delicious, the flora and fauna are jaw-dropping, and the resorts are beyond luxurious. And beyond expensive. Fortunately, you don’t have to sell a kidney to enjoy the wonders of this island, and there are many accommodation options for all travelers, including kuripot ones like you. Here are some budget-friendly picks that might not feel like Aman Pulo, but come pretty close....

item.title: Tourist influx threatens food security in El Nido - Rappler
item.description:
Tourist influx threatens food security in El Nido  Rappler

PALAWAN, Philippines – For years, the world-famous El Nido town in Palawan has lured throngs of tourists from across the globe, thanks to its majestic karst cliffs, white sand beaches, crystal-clear water, and impressive diving sites. But the steady stream of tourists that keeps the local economy thriving comes with a price. For El Nido, a first-class town of 36,000 inhabitants in northern Palawan mainland, the price is the growing food insecurity. Local food production just cannot keep up with the growing number of people to feed, says municipal tourism officer Arvin Acosta. "The food prod...

item.title: Seeing Bea Alonzo Basking Under The Sun Is Something We Could Get Used To - FHM Philippines
item.description:
Seeing Bea Alonzo Basking Under The Sun Is Something We Could Get Used To  FHM Philippines

Bea Alonzo is one heck of an actress. Everyone in the country already knows that. With tons of awards, endorsements, and shows under her belt, the 29-year-old artist, at a very young age, has already made her mark in the industry as one of its youngest superstars. We regularly see her on TV, the big screen, on billboards, and on the cover of top magazines. We’ve seen her become the friend, the girlfriend, the architect, the sister, and even the mistress in a wide range of roles. But throughout the years, there’s a side of her we haven’t yet seen: the beach babe. Seriously, we’ve been follo...

item.title: El Nido: Nest of wonders - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
El Nido: Nest of wonders  Sun.Star Philippines

THIS is not a travel guide for all those who plan to explore the enchanting and magnificent El Nido, Palawan. You’ve got plenty of resources for that and they are just a google away. Rather, this will be a read of why, among all the beautiful destinations in the Philippines, El Nido transcends in every traveling soul’s bucket list. Diverse spots within a tourist spot Philippines is gifted with countless destinations worthy of everyone’s visit. But some areas only offer one to four destinations. El Nido is an exception to that. This spot located in the north of Palawan Island is a combinatio...

item.title: Fishermen rescued off Palawan - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Fishermen rescued off Palawan  CNN Philippines

(CNN Philippines, April 2) — Three fishermen were rescued off the waters of El Nido, Palawan around midnight on Friday. According to the Western Command, Joint Rescue Coordination from Joint Task Force-Malampaya received a phone call from from Coastguard Station- El Nido around 8 p.m. on March 30. A vessel of the Philippine Navy was dispatched to assist and rescue a banca piloted by Ronnie Nacional. A helicopter was also involved in the rescue operation. Rescued along with Nacional were Andres Ubenza and Ryan Reyes. They were found off Barangonan Island, Linapacan, Palawan. Aside from havin...

item.title: Palawan Tops ‘World’s Friendliest Islands’ List - FHM Philippines
item.description:
Palawan Tops ‘World’s Friendliest Islands’ List  FHM Philippines

The Philippines has once again proven that it is among the prime destinations in the world when it comes to picturesque islands with alluring tourist locations. A list created by the Travel + Leisure site called the “World’s Best Awards” included four Philippine islands in their annual ranking. Here, they evaluate essential travel experiences through a survey that includes cruise lines, airports, resorts, cities and hotels. The Philippines took the top four spots in the islands category, where readers scored entries according to characteristics like romantic charm and the friendliness of th...

item.title: There's now a Boracay-El Nido direct flight - Rappler
item.description:
There's now a Boracay-El Nido direct flight  Rappler

EL NIDO, Philippines – El Nido and Boracay are now connected through a 45-minute flight via AirSwift! This means you can get your tan in El Nido in the morning and join the epic parties of Boracay at night on the same day. Because two of the most beautiful and award-winning islands in the world are now linked, there's no need to fly back to Manila or Cebu just to get from one to the other. AirSwift made its maiden flight yesterday, March 17 from Lio Airport in El Nido, Palawan. Carrying a cabin-full of mostly foreign tourists and inaugural guests, it was welcomed at Godofredo Ramos Airport ...

item.title: 17 Jaw-Dropping Outdoor Proposals You Just Have To See - The Huffington Post
item.description:
17 Jaw-Dropping Outdoor Proposals You Just Have To See  The Huffington Post

It’s not just how you pop the question, but where you do it. And when it comes to proposal locations, you simply cannot compete with the splendor of Mother Nature. To that end, we’ve collected 17 outdoor proposal photos so majestic, they’ll take your breath away. 1 Saddle Mountain, Oregon 2 Horseshoe Bend, Page, Arizona 3 El Nido, Palawan, Philippines 4 Vik, Iceland 5 Banff National Park, Alberta, Canada 6 Maui, Hawaii 7 La Cueva del Indio, Puerto Rico 8 Trolltunga in Odda, Norway 9 Kyoto, Japan 10 Pine Valley, St. George, Utah 11 Quebec City, Canada 12 Banff, Alberta, Canada 13 Maui, ...

item.title: AirAsia launches program to promote responsible tourism - ABS CBN News
item.description:
AirAsia launches program to promote responsible tourism  ABS CBN News

Enrique Cabiguen talks about the Cuyunons of Palawan as he invited travelers to visit Sibaltan. Photo by author MANILA -- AirAsia Philippines recently launched its #HowIFly project to promote responsible travel to provide positive impact to the community and environment. The airline's previous #WhyIFly project encouraged travelers to spread the love of travel through stories told via pictures and videos. #HowIFly shifts the focus from inspiring travel to responsible travel. Capt. Dexter Comendador, CEO of AirAsia Philippines, said that this project was influenced by AirAsia’s own internal g...

item.title: Palawan named World’s Best Island, Boracay makes top 3 - Rappler
item.description:
Palawan named World’s Best Island, Boracay makes top 3  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Palawan has once again been named the World’s Best Island in Travel + Leisure’s ranking, maintaining its position on the top of the list for the second year in a row. Travel + Leisure’s annual World’s Best ranking is determined by the magazine’s readers, one of whom has described Palawan as “the single most beautiful place on earth.” Palawan, which came ahead of other beautiful islands including the Galapagos in Ecuador, Santorini in Greece, and Bali in Indonesia, also topped the World’s Best Islands list in 2013. Palawan is where one can find popular tourist destinati...

item.title: 10 Vietnamese poachers arrested off Palawan - Rappler
item.description:
10 Vietnamese poachers arrested off Palawan  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Ten Vietnamese allegedly caught poaching off Palawan province were arrested and will face poaching charges, according to the Philippine military. The naval warship BRP Gregorio Del Pilar was patrolling the West Philippine Sea (South China Sea) on Tuesday, August 8, when it sighted foreign fishing vessel Hua Houng off Palawan's Tapuitan Point. Captain Cherryl Tindog, spokesperson of the military Western Command (Wescom), said the crew of th warship boarded the fishing vessel and found that the Vietnamese crew had on board fine meshed fish net and dead sharks. The warshi...

item.title: WATCH: El Nido tourism gets boost with local beach bar - ABS CBN News
item.description:
WATCH: El Nido tourism gets boost with local beach bar  ABS CBN News

In the early 2000s, El Nido, Palawan was considered a luxury, exclusive destination that seemed too heavy on the pocket. But today, more and more tourists are discovering affordable ways to enjoy El Nido’s beaches with the help of local entrepreneurs who take the business and nature preservation balance very seriously. Island-entrepreneur Vicki Abary talks to Nancy Irlanda on Dateline Philippines Weekend to share how her local beach bar SAVA, has helped boost El Nido’s night life without sacrificing the island’s natural beauty.

item.title: Magazine Names Palawan As The Best Island In The World For 2nd Straight Year - FHM Philippines
item.description:
Magazine Names Palawan As The Best Island In The World For 2nd Straight Year  FHM Philippines

Palawan has once again proven to be the world’s most beautiful island after it got the top spot on the Travel + Leisure magazine’s annual list. According to the travel magazine, the finalists in their World’s Best Awards survey is determined through feedback from their readers based on international travel experiences. They gave Palawan a score of 93.15 points which placed it at number one. "For the second year in a row, the Philippine paradise wins first place as the best island in the world, thanks to its hidden lagoons, teeming ocean life, and rustic-luxe resorts,” T+L said. “There’s not...

item.title: Celebrities enjoy PH tourist destinations during Lenten break - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Celebrities enjoy PH tourist destinations during Lenten break  Sun.Star Philippines

WHILE most showbiz personalities flew abroad this Lenten season, other local celebrities opted to enjoy the beauty of the Philippines. Comedienne Vice Ganda is vacationing in the island of Boracay with close friend, television host Karla Estrada and family. He even uploaded a throwback photo with Estrada alongside a much recent snap which showed their transformations in the past two decades. "20 years ago. Same season. Same place. Same friend," Vice Ganda wrote. 20 years ago. Same season. Same place. Same friend. #CantHelpFallingInLoveWithOurFriendship #UltimatePubertyChallengeEntry A post ...

item.title: 7 places to visit in Philippines this 2017 - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
7 places to visit in Philippines this 2017  Sun.Star Philippines

WITH 7,107 islands, there are plenty of places to explore around the country. Just browse through blogs and social media posts and you'll find that another beach or natural attraction has captured the delight of travelers and adventurers. They are so many that it can last me a whole lifetime just exploring all of them. I have come up with my own list of places in our archipelago that I hope to visit this 2017. If I can tick off even just two of them, it will already make my year a good one. But if my resources can bring me to all of these spots, why not visit them all? Here's my travel wish...

item.title: Cimatu honors slain anti-logging official in El Nido - Rappler
item.description:
Cimatu honors slain anti-logging official in El Nido  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Environment Secretary Roy Cimatu conferred the highest commendation on a village official killed last week in an anti-logging operation in El Nido, Palawan. Cimatu on Friday, September 22, personally presented the "Medalya ng Bayani ng Kalikasan" (Environmental Hero Medal) distinction at the wake of Villa Libertad Barangay Captain Ruben Arzaga. Arzaga was shot dead on September 14 while in an anti-logging operation in the mountainous area in Sitio Batbat. "I salute Captain Ruben for sacrificing his life to protect the environment," Cimatu said, as he handed the plaque ...

Shades Gradation - Taytay - El-Nido - Peurto Princesa - Philippines

item.title: IN PHOTOS: These 4 PH islands are the 'world's friendliest' - Rappler
item.description:
IN PHOTOS: These 4 PH islands are the 'world's friendliest'  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Filipinos are known for their hospitality, and it hasn't escaped the notice of tourists who visit the Philippines. On March 31, Travel + Leisure (T + L) magazine released their list of "World's Friendliest Islands," which mentioned 4 of the Philippines' islands. Boracay, Luzon, Cebu, and Palawan comprised the top 4 of the list, which named 15 destinations in total. (READ: There's now a Boracay-El Nido direct flight) "While the politics of the nation have grown ever-more volatile, the people of the islands remain friendly to visitors exploring their scenic home," wrote ...

item.title: El Nido to impose daily visitor limits in 3 iconic tourist sites - Rappler
item.description:
El Nido to impose daily visitor limits in 3 iconic tourist sites  Rappler

PALAWAN, Philippines - El Nido will start imposing a carrying capacity policy on its 3 iconic sites, which are observed to be disturbed due to the continuous influx of tourists. The management board of the El Nido-Taytay Managed Resource Protected Area (ETMRPA) recently adopted a resolution that will solve the overcrowding and habitat disturbance issues in the Big and Small Lagoons and Secret Beach. As part of strategically managing these tourist sites, the board has set a limit on the daily number of entering visitors, and non-motorized conveyances like kayaks and stand-up paddle boards. M...

item.title: Poaching raps filed vs 10 Vietnamese fishermen in Palawan - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Poaching raps filed vs 10 Vietnamese fishermen in Palawan  Sun.Star Philippines

PUERTO PRINCESA CITY -- Poaching charges have been filed against 10 Vietnamese fishermen who were recently arrested with a haul of around 70 unidentified shark species near the Malampaya natural gas platform off the coast of El Nido, northern Palawan. Palawan provincial prosecutor Allen Ross Rodriguez confirmed to the Philippine News Agency (PNA) early Friday morning that the foreign fishermen were charged past 11 p.m. Thursday, August 10, for infringement of Section 91 of Republic Act 10654. “Yes, they were charged late last night for poaching. Additional charges might be filed against the...

item.title: Thousands of jellyfish stranded at El Nido beach - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Thousands of jellyfish stranded at El Nido beach  Sun.Star Philippines

PUERTO PRINCESA CITY -- Authorities and residents in the town of El Nido, Palawan, are baffled by what seemed to be a stranding phenomenon of several thousands of jellyfish larvae at Nacpan Beach, Sitio Calitang in Barangay Bucana. Photos of the said phenomenon, which was posted on June 16 by El Nido resident Justin Silvestre Albo on his Facebook account, have caught the attention of netizens who initially thought they were juvenile cone shells. Arvin Acosta, tourism operations officer of El Nido, also thought they were shells. “Strange, it looks like some sort of shells, or jellyfish,” he ...

item.title: Gatchalian hits 'shallow' NEA probe into Palawan blackouts - Rappler
item.description:
Gatchalian hits 'shallow' NEA probe into Palawan blackouts  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Senate energy committee chair Sherwin Gatchalian hit the National Electrification Administration (NEA) for its "weak" investigation into the extended power outages that have plagued Palawan since January 2017. Gatchalian, who earlier ordered NEA to probe the crisis, said the results and recommendations submitted to the panel were insufficient, considering the gravity of the problem in the province. NEA is the overall regulator of electric cooperatives in the country. “Di ako happy, preliminary lang yan eh. (I'm not happy with the report, that's just preliminary). NEA s...

item.title: P30-B superhighway project to boost Palawan economy - Rappler
item.description:
P30-B superhighway project to boost Palawan economy  Rappler

PUERTO PRINCESA, Philippines – The Department of Public Works and Highways (DPWH) has kicked off a P30-billion road-widening project here that is expected to boost economic growth in Palawan. The project, part of the national government priority program, will expand to 6 lanes the two-lane national highway that traverses El Nido town in the north to Bataraza town down south, spanning 600 kilometers of the entire mainland Palawan. With an initial P3 billion downloaded to Palawan’s 2nd engineering district, DPWH District Engineer Alejandro Ventilacion said they have started working in the sou...

item.title: Anna Pearson – FHM's #NewCrush December 2016 - FHM Philippines
item.description:
Anna Pearson – FHM's #NewCrush December 2016  FHM Philippines

Anna Pearson is a 22-year old beauty from Ukraine. Her natural good looks and perfectly toned body would make you think that a person like her belongs in the spotlight, but this go-getter prefers to run things from behind the scenes. “I thought of becoming a translator or linguist after school because I learned five different languages but I found that work boring so my friend asked me to try out aviation. Her parents were air traffic controllers and they toured me around their station and showed me how everything worked. I loved every single second of it and that’s when I decided that that...

item.title: Coron VS El Nido: Who Wins In The Battle Of The Beaches? - FHM Philippines
item.description:
Coron VS El Nido: Who Wins In The Battle Of The Beaches?  FHM Philippines

Palawan’s been ranked highly in international travel magazines for some time now, so it’s no secret anymore that the archipelago’s beaches, islands and dive spots are among the most beautiful in the world. But beyond the superlatives, most of us know little about what the difference is between its two most desirable destinations: Coron and El Nido. While it’s nice to be pleasantly surprised on your travels, having a general idea of what to expect goes a long way in deciding on a trip. Here’s our comparison of the two very different patches of paradise in Palawan. IMAGE Christopher Puhm Flyi...

item.title: Why El Nido Should Be Every Woman's Next Solo Travel Destination - Female Network
item.description:
Why El Nido Should Be Every Woman's Next Solo Travel Destination  Female Network

IMAGE Pixabay Puerto Princesa in Palawan was still a quiet, sleepy city the first time I visited it. With the exception of famous establishments such as Kinabuch and KaLui, many small restaurants and shops would close at eight or nine o’clock, and the streets were so tranquil that you could almost hear the night settling in. I remember back-riding on a motorcycle, looking up at the bright stars, and thinking that I was in one of the most beautiful places on earth. “Wait until you see El Nido,” my friend Wendi who was born and raised in the province told me. Her then boyfriend (now husband) ...

item.title: Touring with Mei: Colors of Mei (Last of three parts) - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Touring with Mei: Colors of Mei (Last of three parts)  Sun.Star Philippines

DURING the tour in Sagada, El Nido, and Zamboanga City, I was not only introduced to the amazing destinations in the Philippines but I also got to meet the wonderful Meileilan Usin-Mattinson (colorsofmei.com), whom I worked with for her Philippine Tour. Mei, who hails from Zamboanga City and now based in Wisconsin, United States (US), started blogging around a year ago after her wedding. However, it took her a while to finally start her blog as she was focused in achieving her goals in the medical field. She is currently a nurse anesthesiologist in the US. "I knew that fashion is in me, tim...

item.title: Touring with Mei: Serene and stunning El Nido (2nd of 3 parts) - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Touring with Mei: Serene and stunning El Nido (2nd of 3 parts)  Sun.Star Philippines

FROM the highlands of Northern Luzon, the second part of Mei's (colorsofmei.com) Philippine Tour 2017 brought us to the islands and beaches of El Nido, Palawan. El Nido has lots of beaches and islands that will surely captivate and wow you. For our tour in El Nido, we booked Tour C for our first day and Tour A for our second. In tour A, we visited the Small Lagoon, Secret Lagoon, Big Lagoon, Secret Beach, Shimizu Island, and Seven Commandos Beach while in Tour C, we visited the Hidden Beach, Secret Beach, Star Beach, Matinloc Shrine, and Helicopter Island. Each island and beach has its own ...

item.title: Cebu emerges big winner at first Choose Philippines Awards - ABS CBN News
item.description:
Cebu emerges big winner at first Choose Philippines Awards  ABS CBN News

El Nido Resorts in Palawan won Best Destination, Islands and Beaches category at the first Choose Philippines Awards at the ABS-CBN Dolphy Theatre on Thursday. Photo courtesy of El Nido official website MANILA, Philippines — The country’s best tourism offerings — from food to vacation destinations — were recognized in the first Choose Philippines Awards at the ABS-CBN Dolphy Theatre on Thursday. Cebu bagged the most trophies, winning Best Accommodation for solo travelers (Plantation Bay Resort and Spa) Best Water Form (Kawasan Falls) and Best Festival (Sinulog). City government officials, t...

item.title: Former Miss Universe beauties sizzle in Palawan - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Former Miss Universe beauties sizzle in Palawan  Sun.Star Philippines

WHILE everyone is engrossed with the Miss Universe festivities in Manila, a set of beauty queens were also taking Palawan by storm. Led by Miss Universe 2015 second runner-up Olivia Jordan, the group of former Miss Universe entrants sizzled in their red bikini while exploring the island of El Nido. Jordan was joined by Miss Universe 2014 first runner-up Nia Sanchez and local beauties, Miss International 2013 Bea Rose Santiago and Miss Universe Philippines 2014 Mary Jean Lastimosa. Thank you @mj_lastimosa for inviting me to be with your hot friends! We released our inner baywatch thanks to @...

item.title: See Where The Country's Sexiest Ladies Spent Their Holidays In 2017 - FHM Philippines
item.description:
See Where The Country's Sexiest Ladies Spent Their Holidays In 2017  FHM Philippines

For some of our favorite women, the first half of 2017 was filled with airplane rides and adventurous nights. Thanks to Instagram, we get to see what the lovely ladies have been to from January to July. Some preferred visiting local spots, while others got on the plane to explore the world. It’s such a wonderful sight, seeing these ladies having while on vacation, or heck, even on workation. In case you’re still planning your getaway and clueless as to where to go, why don’t you take a cue from these jetsetting babes—the top 20 from this year’s FHM 100 Sexiest Women list. These girls know h...

item.title: Padilla: Palawan - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Padilla: Palawan  Sun.Star Philippines

IT WAS unplanned. Just one of those long, wandering conversations with a good friend based in Manila. Suddenly I was booked for Palawan and I packed a suitcase full of beach-and-bum clothes and hide off to the island. I wasn’t expecting anything fantastic because Puerto Princesa and the Palawan beaches at the North (El Nido and Coron) were already The Places beach dreams were made of. Old Puerto Princesa haunts included homage to Ka Lui’s. From its cramped bamboo space, Ka Lui’s has expanded to include a mini gallery of paintings done by local artists and a small stage for concerts. The men...

item.title: TripAdvisor names El Nido as 6th Top Destination on the Rise - CNN Philippines
item.description:
TripAdvisor names El Nido as 6th Top Destination on the Rise  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines) — Fancy going somewhere fabulous and different for the holidays? According to travel website TripAdvisor, you don't even have to leave the Philippines to find it. El Nido in Palawan was named the sixth Top Destination on the Rise worldwide in the TripAdvisor Travelers' Choice Awards 2016. "Why settle for a beachfront hotel when you can stay right over the ocean in a cottage on stilts?" the travel website said. "And why settle for any old dive site when you can snorkel in an orchid-walled lagoon? El Nido is known as the Philippines' last frontier, and if you're...

item.title: 50 more establishments in El Nido face closure - Rappler
item.description:
50 more establishments in El Nido face closure  Rappler

PUERTO PRINCESA, Philippines – The El Nido municipal government on Thursday, November 15, said 50 tourism establishments are facing closure for violating the 3-meter coastal easement policy in the town. El Nido town administrator RJ de la Calzada said the municipal government is assessing the progress of the self-demolition made by establishments that encroached on the easement zone along Corong-corong beach. De la Calzada said the two-week ultimatum given to the erring establishment owners to comply with the easement policy lapsed this week. “If they didn’t comply to the self-demolition or...

item.title: Rehabilitation set for 'overcrowded' El Nido, Palawan - Rappler
item.description:
Rehabilitation set for 'overcrowded' El Nido, Palawan  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – After Boracay reopened its shores following a 6-month closure, another top tourist destination is up for rehabilitation. In a press briefing on Wednesday, November 14, Tourism Secretary Bernadette Romulo Puyat described El Nido, Palawan, as "overcrowded." Puyat said she noticed there were too many kayaks and boats, which resulted in pollution. She said government agencies will come up with a study similar to the one done for Boracay, which would determine El Nido's carrying capacity. (IN CHARTS: Boracay is bursting at the seams) However, Environment Secretary Roy Cimat...
